column4: I installed ubuntu, and get's can't connect to the wireless networks (secured and unsecured)
just when I connect to them, it doesn't
here's an idea: explain your problem in one single sentence / without hitting the return key 5 times, much more readable that way.
seems like an issue with your network driver, check what driver you're running and ask in their support channel
when installing it found my driver and installed it.  Because I can see the wireless networks, would that mean that my card is working (at least partially?)
the driver actually comes with ubuntu 9, from what I understand.
yes, it is working, it's just having a hard time connecting -- not sure anyone in here knows enough about your card to be able to help you, try dmesg to see if you get any messages there
even though the driver shipped with Ubuntu, Ubuntu didn't create it.
check which driver you are running, and write it down, we will try to get you some support
not right now, I can try to work that out.  Is there a specific command to get the driver details that are being used?
okay.  I am also using a router, does that impact anything?
thks for your help, I'll give this a try.
